definition: not to tire of/not to object to
(negative prefix)/not/no
to loathe
not to mind taking all the trouble (idiom)/to take great pains/to be very patient
there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
to be worth reading a hundred times (idiom)
The story is so good it's worth hearing a hundred times./One never tires of hearing good new.
pinyin: hao3 gu4 shi5 bai3 ting1 bu4 yan4

definition: study tirelessly, teach with endless enthusiasm (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 yan4 , hui4 ren2 bu4 juan4

definition: worth hearing a hundred times
lit. to eat but finely ground grain and finely chopped meat (idiom, from Analects)/fig. to be fastidious about one's food
pinyin: shi2 bu4 yan4 jing1 , kuai4 bu4 yan4 xi4

definition: lit. to eat but finely ground grain and finely chopped meat (idiom, from Analects)/fig. to be fastidious about one's food
pinyin: shi2 bu4 yan4 jing1 , kuai4 bu4 yan4 xi4

sentences.english: The Xerox is a good office assistant, which you never get tired of using.
sentences.chinese: 靜電覆印機，文祕好助手，百用不厭。

sentences.english: You never get tired of hearing this story.
You never get tired of reading this book.
One dish is always asked for over and over—pot roast and potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 其中有一道菜他們百喫不厭，那就是燉肉加土豆。

sentences.english: The shop assistants in this bookstore are ever ready FOR inquiry and service.
sentences.chinese: 這家書店的售貨員百問不厭，百拿不煩。

sentences.english: Comrade Bocheng is a fine example of a tireless reader.
sentences.chinese: 伯承同志是勤讀不厭的模範。

sentences.english: Tianhe not object to Cowboy wide, but Weaver for Huan Firestone .
sentences.chinese: 牛郎不厭天河闊，織女但求凡世歡。

sentences.english: Which eyes not yet created shall o'er-read;
sentences.chinese: 百讀不厭的將是未來的眼睛。

sentences.english: One never tires of watching lovely red-crowned cranes.
sentences.chinese: 優雅的丹頂鶴令人百看不厭。

sentences.english: What album will you never grow tired of listening to?
sentences.chinese: 有哪張唱片是妳百聽不厭的？

sentences.english: Because of the smell of solicitation in the air, and because we are usually in the middle of it.
sentences.chinese: 而是由於不厭其煩的教唆，而且我們經常置身於其中。

sentences.english: He go on at tedious length about his favourite hobby.
sentences.chinese: 他仍不厭其詳地講他的業餘愛好。

sentences.english: May you never stop learning for as long as you live.
sentences.chinese: 願的追求宵衣旰食，願永遠學而不厭。

sentences.english: I never tire of reading classics.
sentences.chinese: 這些古典名著我百讀不厭。

sentences.english: Given an audience with President Lincoln, he discoursed at length on the high and ancient nobility of his distinguished family.
sentences.chinese: 他不厭其煩細說自己家世顯赫，自古就是高門貴族。

sentences.english: She adjusted her coloured head scarf fussily…
sentences.chinese: 她不厭其煩地調弄着自己的彩色頭巾。

definition: to loathe
often/constantly
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to pay no attention to/to disregard/to ignore/to let go unpunished/to let off
not completely/endlessly
to write a book
how? (emphatic question)
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
old affair/former matter
agreeable
to taste/to try/to experience/already/ever/once
to read aloud/to recite
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
that being the case/then/in that case
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
in a flash/in a jiffy
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
